title: How The New York Times Investigated Videos of ICE Agents Killing Alex Pretti
summary: Using more than a dozen videos related to the shooting of Alex Pretti, The Times worked to establish what is called ground truth: what happened, how it happened and who might be responsible.

title: After Alex Pretti’s Killing, A Divided America Wonders What’s Next
summary: Scenes from the violent unrest in Minneapolis played on a loop in many American households over the weekend, prompting reflection about where the nation is heading.

title: Trump Changes Course in Minneapolis, and Social Media Giants Face Big Tobacco-Style Lawsuits
summary: Plus, Mamdani’s snowstorm recommendation.

title: Record Debt in the World’s Richest Nations Threatens Global Growth
summary: The cost of borrowing is already choking crucial public spending in many developing economies. Now it’s raising broader alarms.

title: Fed, Signaling Little Urgency, Prepares to Pause on Rate Cuts
summary: The Federal Reserve is expected to hold interest rates steady on Wednesday, despite relentless attacks from President Trump over borrowing costs.

title: As Trump Heads to Iowa to Trumpet Economy, Many Residents Feel Pain
summary: Farmers are critical to Iowa’s economy. They have been battered by President Trump’s tariffs and are not yet experiencing the “golden age” that the president promised.

title: Winter Storm Debilitates the South, Encasing Cities in Ice and Snow
summary: The forecasts had predicted that the storm could be among the worst in a generation to hit the region. By Monday, it was clear that is exactly what happened.

title: What to Expect for a Cold NYC Commute: Trains, Buses and Rail
summary: Mass transit is slowly getting back to normal around the city.

title: New York City Races to Help Homeless People as Temperatures Plunge
summary: The weather underscored how vulnerable people are when they do not have a safe place to shelter. At least eight people have died, including several who had a history with the city’s shelter system.

title: After Donations, Trump Administration Revoked Rule Requiring More Nursing Home Staff
summary: Executives who donated to the president’s super PAC met privately with him and urged a repeal of the rule, which was intended to prevent neglect of patients.

title: Extra Scrutiny of FEMA Aid to States Has Created a $17 Billion Bottleneck
summary: Additional layers of review ordered by Kristi Noem, the homeland security secretary, have slowed assistance to disaster-struck communities.

title: ‘Volcano,’ the L.A. Disaster Movie That Boils Over With Unintended Comedy
summary: Tommy Lee Jones and Anne Heche teamed up in their heyday to save Los Angeles from lava in this big-budget 1997 film that defies all logic to fantastic, farcical effect.

title: Work Will Stop on Critical Tunnel Project Unless Trump Restores Funding
summary: The builders of the Gateway project, a critical rail tunnel between New York and New Jersey, are expected to warn that construction cannot continue without the withheld federal money.

title: How Trump’s Threats to Greenland Made Him a Liability for Europe’s Far Right
summary: Europe’s nationalist leaders once saw President Trump as an ideological ally. Now, as he threatens European sovereignty, they are seeking distance — at least for the moment.

title: Trump Administration Social Media Posts Echo White Supremacist Messaging
summary: A flurry of posts from the White House, Department of Labor and Department of Homeland Security have included images, slogans and even a song used by the white nationalist right.

title: UK Seeks Trade With China Without Triggering Trump’s Fury
summary: Prime Minister Keir Starmer hopes to boost his country’s lagging economy with a trip to Beijing. But he must carefully navigate between two superpowers.

title: In Trump’s Shadow, India and the European Union Expand Trade Ties
summary: After nearly 20 years of negotiations, the two sides struck a far-reaching agreement that officials called “the mother of all trade deals.”

title: Trump Vows Higher Tariffs for South Korea Months After Trade Deal
summary: President Trump said Seoul was not moving fast enough to implement the agreement, which calls for South Korea to invest billions in the United States.

title: Social Media Giants Face Landmark Legal Tests on Child Safety
summary: Starting this week, a series of trials will test a new legal strategy claiming that Meta, TikTok, Snap and YouTube caused personal injury through addictive products.

title: The Social Media Addiction Trials: What to Know
summary: Landmark trials beginning this week will test a new legal strategy claiming that Meta, TikTok, Snap and YouTube caused personal injury through addictive products.

title: All-Night Concerts in War-Ravaged Myanmar
summary: But the shows, which combine dance, drama and music, are also part of an effort by Myanmar’s military rulers to project a veneer of legitimacy.

title: An Academic and a Dealmaker Takes on the Challenge of Running Columbia
summary: Jennifer Mnookin forged compromises with protesters and politicians at the University of Wisconsin-Madison. Now, she faces her biggest test.

title: Trial to Begin in Sex-Trafficking Case Against Alexander Brothers
summary: Prosecutors say the three men used their money, power and status to sexually assault women, including two underage girls. The men have denied the charges.

title: Brothers Charged With Sex Trafficking Wage Campaign to Shame Accusers
summary: The Alexander brothers, once titans of the New York party scene, have retained a high-stakes public relations strategist, Juda Engelmayer, whose clients include Harvey Weinstein.

title: Want Nirvana? Try a Colonoscopy.
summary: It turns out that despite everything you’ve heard, getting a colonoscopy is wonderful.

title: Mike Lawler: Minneapolis Deaths Show America Needs a New Immigration Plan
summary: A Republican member of Congress argues that neither Biden nor Trump had the right solution on immigration.

title: Trump’s Fantasies Are Killing Us
summary: But being a “hot” country does not make you a good country. Or a decent one.

title: Transportation Safety Board Set to Declare Cause of Midair Collision
summary: The National Transportation Safety Board is set to vote on the probable cause of last year’s crash near Washington and make recommendations.

title: You Wouldn’t Want to Butt Heads With This Small Dinosaur
summary: A newly discovered raptor had a knobby bump on its head, suggesting that, like some larger dinosaurs, it engaged in competitive head bashing.

title: Alexander Vindman, of Trump Impeachment Fame, Runs for Senate in Florida
summary: Mr. Vindman will run for the Democratic nomination to take on Senator Ashley Moody, a Republican. The race is an uphill fight for Democrats, but Mr. Vindman could be a strong fund-raiser.
